name: Airport Panic
description:
Playable 3D simulation of this   classic handheld electronic game including views of the original packaging and instruction guide . A RetroFab simulation Version 0.9.6a Details Title Airport Panic Model No. 16818 Series LCD Solarpower ( Double Panel ) Manufacturer Bandai Electronics Release Date 1982 Description

The LCD Solarpower series by Bandai Electronics were handheld electronic games that were powered by solar energy. Games in the Double Panel edition of the series, like Airport Panic released in 1982, featured two LCD panels stacked on top of each other that allowed the games to progress across two distinct stages for more variation in gameplay.

Gameplay

Hijackers have boarded a plane at the airport and taken the passengers hostage. Your mission is to board the plane and take out the hijackers. Gameplay takes place over two stages:

  • Stage 1 - At the airport
    Move across the runway and board the airplane from the right side of the staircase. Watch out for bombs being thrown by the hijackers from the airplane. You can hide behind cars crossing the runway to avoid the bombs. Successfully board the airplane 3 times to advance to the next stage.
     
  • Stage 2 - In the airplane
    Once onboard the airplane you'll need to shoot the hijacker 10 times to rescue the passengers and crew. But be careful not to inadvertently shoot passengers jumping up from their seats which will result in a penalty of 30 points. If you're shot by the hijacker you'll lose 1 life. Lose all 3 lives and the game is over.
Controls Keyboard Up W or Up Arrow Down S or Down Arrow Left A or Left Arrow Right D or Right Arrow Fire Enter or Ctrl Mouse Rotate Drag Press Left-click Zoom Mousewheel Resources Audio Leo Kaizer ( youtube.com ) Box Art Handheld Empire ( handheldempire.com )
